alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Chattooga; Floyd; Gordon (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Floyd, southwestern Gordon, central Chattooga and northwestern Bartow Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 929 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Tidings, or 8 miles southeast of Summerville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Rome, Calhoun, Adairsville, Plainville, Shannon, Pinson, Oostanaula, Tidings, Armuchee, Everett Springs, James H. Floyd State Park, Holland and Lindale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
